description:
With the recent Firefox 136 update, Mozilla’s web browser got several improvements and new features, including vertical tabs that sit in a new sidebar and provide a better overview when you have tons of open tabs. The update brings improved security via fixed vulnerabilities, which apply to Firefox ESR and Tor Browser as well.

Mozilla’s 2025-14 Security Advisory report shows at least 15 fixed vulnerabilities in Firefox 136, with a “high” risk rating given to five entries for individual vulnerabilities reported by external researchers. For example, the CVE-2025-1930 vulnerability can be used to break out of the browser sandbox on Windows.

In addition, there are three summarized entries on internally di
title: Firefox 136 brings native vertical tabs (finally!) and security fixes

description:
Slowly but surely, OLED monitors are dropping down to attainable prices. Dell and Alienware consistently deliver some of the best prices in the category, and Alienware’s new 27-inch 1440p OLED is the cheapest yet. The new design debuts this summer with a price of just $549.99.

That’s an amazing price for an OLED monitor, especially with its 280Hz refresh rate and 0.03ms response time. The Alienware AW2725D gives you the usual gaming goodies like G-Sync and FreeSync compatibility, and the “sweet spot” 1440p resolution that’s extremely popular at the moment. Alienware is using a new stand design and some updated aesthetics, too. Other technical details will have to wait for the “Summer 2025” release date in North America. (The exterior design for this monitor isn’t finished yet, apparently, so the header image above is the new AW2725Q 4K 27-incher
title: Alienware’s next 1440p OLED gaming monitor will be its cheapest yet

description:
What’s the easiest way to get some extra storage space on your laptop? Grab a flash drive! It doesn’t even have to cost you much because there are sweet deals like this one: Samsung’s 256GB Fit Plus is only $23 on Amazon, a considerable 34 percent discount.

This is an absolutely tiny flash drive that basically goes invisible once it’s plugged into your laptop (or whatever other device). Thankfully, it has a nifty lanyard hole so you can hook it up to a keychain, for example, and not worry about losing it. It’s robust enough to withstand bumps and drops, and protected against water, heat, magnets, and even X-rays.

Its compact size makes it easy to carry anywhere and plug into anything, including laptops, PCs, gaming consoles, and even your car’s media sys
title: Samsung’s compact 256GB USB flash drive is only $23 right now

description:
YouTube Premium ain’t cheap at $13.99 per month for ad-free streaming, especially since it seems like YouTube is intentionally making itself worse to get you to pay up. How does $7.99 sound instead?

Starting today, YouTube is offering its Premium Lite paid tier to users in the US after having tested it out in a handful of other countries. You pay less for fewer features, but you still get to block ads… mostly.

According to the announcement, YouTube Premium Lite offers a mostly ad-free experience for watching videos on desktop and mobile apps, but there are a few provisos and quid-pro-quos. First, you don’t get to play videos in the backgr
title: YouTube launches cheaper $8 Premium Lite plan without the best parts

description:
Apple unveiled new 13- and 15-inch MacBook Air models Wednesday, as the company continued its week of Air-themed product announcements. The new MacBook Airs aren’t exactly groundbreaking—it’s no surprise Apple didn’t feel it necessary to save these for a blockbuster press event—but their upgrades are quietly worthwhile. They certainly outdo the previous day’s underwhelming iPad Air refresh.

Like that new iPad, the new MacBooks are based around a processor upgrade: both models now run an M4 (up from an M3). That’s the newest and most powerful generation of Apple chips, so you can expect searing fast performance. Just bear
title: Apple unveils cheaper MacBook Air with M4 chips and a better camera

description:
Samsung’s huge Discover Spring Sale is underway and there are some pretty impressive discounts going on, saving you hundreds on phones, smartwatches, and some of the very best monitors out there, just to name a few.

Let’s dive in and see how much you can save during this spring’s Samsung Discover event. New deals will be added throughout the week, so stay tuned for even more great deals in the coming days.

Samsung monitor deals

  • Samsung 34″ Odyssey OLED G8: You can get one of these for $785 righ
title: Samsung spring sale: Save $815 on a big OLED monitor, get a 2nd monitor free

description:
If your wallet’s feeling lighter this week, you probably already know why. With President Trump implementing his 25 percent tariff on goods imported from Canada and Mexico, and doubling his existing tariff on Chinese imports to 20 percent, two of the biggest retailers in the US are warning shoppers that prices will rise almost immediately.

CNN quotes Best Buy CEO Corie Barry, who says that “we’ve never seen this kind of breadth of tariffs.” She expects manufacturers to pass rising costs onto retailers and, effectively, consumers. Target CEO Brian Cornell said the same to CNBC: “The consumer will likely see price increases over the next couple of d
title: Best Buy and Target warn of price jumps caused by Trump’s tariffs

description:
Unless you’ve spent the last twelve hours or so in a tent outside a Best Buy, you probably don’t have a new Nvidia card in your hands right now. In a depressingly familiar sight, the RTX 5070 has immediately sold out at every online retailer, following the same pattern as the RTX 5070 Ti and 5080/5090 launches over the last few weeks. Initial stocks are depleted despite huge markups on most models.

Less than ten minutes after the 9 AM EST launch, Best Buy, Newegg, and B&H all showed every single RTX 5070 card as out of stock or otherwise unavailable. Between high demand from PC gamers (and the scalpers who want to take adv
title: Nvidia’s RTX 5070 cards sell out immediately, despite high prices

description:
I don’t always highlight flash deals because they’re usually not worth it, but I couldn’t ignore this Lenovo IdeaPad 5 deal at B&H. Today only, you can get the laptop for $500 — a whopping 50 percent off!

This laptop features a fast Snapdragon X Plus CPU and 16GB of LPDDR5X RAM that’ll breeze through your everyday tasks with ease. It also packs a 1TB SSD for ultra-fast bootups, app load times, and file transfer speeds. Plus, that’s a lot of storage space for years to come.

With its 14-inch multi-touch OLED display and 1920×1200 resolution, the IdeaPad 5 looks crisp and delivers vivid images with deep contrast. Whether you’re churning through spreadsheets or streaming Netflix, you’re going to love what you see. And with its 360-degree
title: Lenovo’s premium Snapdragon 2-in-1 laptop is 50% off, today only!

description:
Microsoft skills are in demand, whether you’re breaking into IT, advancing your career, or future-proofing your skill set. The Microsoft Tech Certification Training Super Bundle offers lifetime access to expert-led courses covering the ins and outs of Azure, Microsoft 365, IT security, and Windows administration—all for just $59.97 (reg. $429).

Cloud computing and cybersecurity are shaping the future of tech, and Microsoft certifications help you stand out. This bundle provides in-depth training in key areas l
title: Level up your Microsoft IT skill training bundle

description:
TL;DR: Get a 2TB FolderFort Cloud Storage Lifetime Subscription on sale for $109.97 until March 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT. 

Cloud storage subscriptions are expensive. Have you seen the price of Dropbox? It’s kind of like renting an apartment for all your photos, videos, and the work files you really can’t afford to delete. If you want to give your files a forever home, then check this out.
title: The price of a 2TB cloud storage subscription just dropped by $390
